channel.title: RS Voice Chat
channel.description:
I was wondering if anyone here has done anything with RS and a 3rd party voice program (mumble, vent, teamspeak)
What I envision is that people can talk into the mic but only players within their view area would be able to hear it and be able to talk back. Which would obviously be done with the Area/Region system RS related but whats publicly available out there on the web that I can use to tackle the voice end of things.
Free free to suggest your lovely knowledge.

item.title: RS Voice Chat
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:18, topic:552437”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=671355.msg4489770#msg4489770 date=1436875450]
I’m fairly positive Jagex addressed why they never added voicechat somewhere in the developer logs. Pretty sure it had to do with limitations of size of data being sent to the client so if you wanted to add something like that you had to make significant changes.
[/quote]

Sounds kind of like laziness to me. Other online games have managed to pull it off. I think it would have just been too hard to censor, of which Jagex is so very fond.[/quote]
they could just ask the NSA tho

Read full topic

item.title: RS Voice Chat
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:15, topic:552437”][quote author=my-swagger link=topic=671355.msg4489788#msg4489788 date=1436889112]
What happens when you walk too far away whilst in a good conversation with people? There goes your region chatting system
[/quote]

Then you cant text chat either, get the fudge off.[/quote]
what’s pming for then?

item.title: RS Voice Chat
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“sini, post:11, topic:552437”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=671355.msg4489777#msg4489777 date=1436883482]
Have a mumble server and move people to different rooms based on which region they are in.
[/quote]

That’d potentially be a shit ton of rooms. Why not just allow people to voice chat in clan chats? Or create voice chat rooms? I bet you could use curse voice for that if they have an API.[/quote]
Of course, but it the intention was to have region specific voice chat, that could be a solution.

Read full topic

item.title: RS Voice Chat
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

Whats the best option for Java, since the first 2 have Java wrapper implementations and speex is old as fudge. Anybody who has ever tinkered with this in the past, whats implementation friendly?

Probably opus via https://github.com/jitsi/libjitsi

Read full topic

item.title: RS Voice Chat
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

easier to integrate it to the client using a codec suited for it like. note you’d need to relay the audio stream to the server and broadcast it to clients within the area since the clients are not peer to peer. i’m curious how much latency that would cause.

Comparison of common speech codecs:

opus_comparison.png692×513

Read full topic

item.title: RS Voice Chat
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

I don’t want to integrate it with the server/client. All I want is for a 3rd party program to only send voice chat to people who are within the viewarea of the game. So the server will have an interface for the 3rd party program to check and send the limited chat.

I think it would be a huge waste of bandwidth and data usage to handle all that chat anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: RS Voice Chat
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

I think the hardest part would be the sound quality. A lot of people don’t realize how much programs like Skype, TS, Vent, or Mumble do to help with the sound quality.

But I’ve thought about this in the past, and I think it would be cool to see it implemented in a server. Before you know it Jagex will add it to their game shortly after someone here does it.

But we’ve messed around with doing chat software via java in the past, and the biggest problem was the levels of audio were crazy, and there was a lot of echoing going on.

Read full topic
